name: biomni-identify-transcription-factor-binding-sites
title: Biomni: Identify Transcription Factor Binding Sites
description: Identify binding sites for specific transcription factors in genomic sequences
content:
Overview

This tool identifies transcription factor binding sites (TFBS) in genomic DNA sequences using position weight matrices (PWMs) and scoring algorithms. It searches for potential regulatory elements where specific transcription factors may bind, calculates binding affinity scores, and predicts functional regulatory regions. The tool integrates with transcription factor databases to provide accurate motif matching and supports both forward and reverse strand scanning.

Input Parameters

  • sequence (string): Path to file containing genomic DNA sequence, or the DNA sequence string itself
  • tf_name (string): Name of transcription factor to search (e.g., 'Hsf1', 'GATA1', 'p53', 'NF-kB')
  • threshold (float, optional): Minimum normalized score threshold for binding site prediction, range 0.0-1.0 (default: 0.8)
  • output_file (string, optional): Custom filename for results output (default: '{tf_name}_binding_sites.tsv')

Input Format

Genomic sequence (file or string):
ATCGATCGATCGGATAAGCTAGCTAGCTATTATATATATCGCGCGCG
GCTAGCTAGCTAGCTAGCTAGCTAGCTAGCTAGCTAGCTAGCTAGCTA

Transcription factor name examples:
- "p53" (tumor suppressor)
- "GATA1" (erythroid development)
- "NF-kB" (immune response)
- "Hsf1" (heat shock response)

Threshold range: 0.0 (permissive) to 1.0 (strict)

Biological Use Case

Essential for gene regulation studies: identifying regulatory elements in promoters and enhancers, predicting transcription factor binding in ChIP-seq peaks, analyzing mutations affecting transcription factor binding, studying cis-regulatory evolution, designing synthetic promoters, understanding gene expression control, and prioritizing non-coding variants from GWAS. Useful for elucidating transcriptional networks and regulatory mechanisms underlying development and disease.

Output

Produces binding site predictions with: tab-separated values (TSV) file containing position, strand, sequence, and score for each predicted binding site, sorted by binding affinity score, genomic coordinates of high-confidence sites, consensus sequence matches, and analysis log file ({tf_name}_tfbs_analysis_log.txt) with search parameters, total sites found, score distribution, and quality metrics.

Category

genetics
